title: Final Atlas V 531 to launch dual SES-20 and SES-21 satellites
summary: United Launch Alliance (ULA) is ready to launch the dual-manifested SES-20 & 21 telecommunication satellites on the final Atlas V 531 rocket to a near-circular geosynchronous orbit (GSO). The Atlas V will launch from Space Launch Complex-41 (SLC-41) at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station (CCSFS) on Oct. 4 during a 45-minute launch window opening at 5:36 PM EDT (21:36 UTC).

title: NASA Science Leadership to Hold Town Hall Meeting Thursday
summary: NASA will hold a community town hall meeting with Associate Administrator for Science Thomas Zurbuchen and his leadership team at 10:30 a.m. EDT on Thursday, Oct. 6. The group will discuss updates to the agency’s science program and share the status of activities.

title: SpaceX has been bidding against itself for NASA’s science missions for a while
summary: "NASA is not able to share the number of bids."

title: EnerStar Solutions announces third Starlink enterprise reseller deal
summary: Canada-based EnerStar Solutions, a rental company for the energy sector, said Oct. 3 it has reached a deal to add SpaceX’s Starlink broadband to the services it provides industrial workers.

title: Redwire back on acquisition trail with deal for QinetiQ Space
summary: British defense firm Qinetiq is selling its Belgian commercial satellite systems division to Redwire, a U.S.-based consolidator of space infrastructure.

title: SpaceX delays launch of 52 Starlink satellites from Vandenberg
summary: SpaceX’s Falcon 9 B1071-5 is ready to launch 52 Starlink satellites from Space Launch Complex 4 East (SLC-4E) at Vandenberg Space Force Base, in California. The Starlink 4-29 mission was targeting launch on Monday, Oct. 3; however, a report from T.S. Kelso on Twitter, who provides prelaunch tracking information from SpaceX, indicates a 24-hour delay to the mission to Tuesday, Oct. 4, at 4:35 PM PDT (23:35 UTC).

title: Atlas 5 rocket rolls launch pad at Cape Canaveral with two SES comsats
summary: United Launch Alliance hauled an Atlas 5 rocket to its launch pad Monday at Cape Canaveral on the eve of a planned blastoff with two commercial television broadcasting satellites for SES, owner of one of the largest fleets of geostationary communications spacecraft.

title: After an amazing run at Mars, India says its orbiter has no more fuel
summary: The orbiter most definitely exceeded expectations.

title: Viasat sells tactical data communications business to L3Harris for $1.96 billion
summary: L3Harris Technologies has agreed to acquire Viasat’s tactical data link business for $1.96 billion, the companies announced Oct. 3.

title: SpaceX crew mission ‘top priority’ amid busy week of Falcon 9 launches
summary: SpaceX’s next astronaut launch for NASA, set for Wednesday from Kennedy Space Center, is one of three missions on the company’s schedule this week from launch pads in Florida and California. The crew mission will get top priority, a SpaceX official said, as managers watch downrange sea conditions and technicians try to resolve final technical issues before liftoff.
